Night Shift carefully scans Darkhawk's body for damages, with very gentile =
hands along each limb.  He remains calm through the ordeal of being stuck d=
own a hole and then replies to Perceptor.

"Look, I don't care who's on who=
's side right now, thing is, were here and we gotta work tagether. No if's =
and's or buts.  All I know is that Darkhawk's hurt and I wanna find out how=
 serious his injuries are. And Tucson Prime wants ta know the same thing.  =
Ya see, that's who we are, we look out for each other, and sometimes even o=
ur enemies."

Tucson Prime could still hear echoes resounding in the dark d=
itch, and he uses his sharp hearing to try and listen for a way out.  He co=
ncentrates on any slight sound he may be able to pick up.  Then, his sense =
of touch quickly sharpens, as he feels the hot breezes of the lava pit touc=
h his hand as he felt for breezes through his fingers.  He could also hear =
Rodimus getting a bit frustrated.  He couldn't blame him.  It was quite the=
 tribulation of dealing with a blind comrade who is at the present time wit=
hout his finest of sonar gear.  

"It's all right Rodimus, I understand thi=
s is hard for you.  We never really know how lucky we are, until something =
very vital to our survival is taken away from us.  We will get out of here,=
 and when we do, I promise to have extensive repairs on my optic sensors an=
d visual components which will indeed be permanent.  Perhaps what is done f=
or me, could also be done for Perceptor.  That's if, Perceptor, you wish to=
 come with us.  I don't need my eyes to understand what has happened to all=
 of you who serve Hydras. I see a lot of talent among all of you, a talent =
he fails to see, and acknowledge with compassion.  I think this may have ha=
ppened for a reason."

He directs his attentions to Dark Hawk first.

"Dark=
hawk, your tactical skills as a warrior are exceptional. I'm rather impress=
ed with the way you nearly saw me for scrap.  Talents like that need to be =
appreciated and if you were to work with me, I'd deeply appreciate them."

=
He then directs his attentions to Perceptor.

"Perceptor, your understandin=
g of intel is also highly impressive.  You'd be a great asset to me and in =
return for your exceptional skills, I'd offer you anything you think you ma=
y need or want.  And if it's freedom you desire, then that I will gladly gi=
ve you. You see, everyone, Rodimus, Night Shift, Perceptor, Darkhawk, we ma=
y be on different factions but we were made from the same creator.  Are we =
really that different from each other?  I don't think so."  

Tucson Prime =
could now see the situation as a whole even though right now he was blind. =
 Perceptor and Darkhawk served Hydras, an evil power hungry leader who want=
ed nothing but domination and destruction. And if anyone dared to fail in t=
heir duties, he'd shove them asside, as he had done with Perceptor and Dark=
 Hawk.  He felt sorry for them, and it panged at his heart spark to know th=
at Hydras could be so cruel to them.  And for the first time, sensing Dark =
Hawk near him, he puts a gentile hand on his shoulder, rather than a clench=
ing painful fist around it.  

"What ever side you chose, it's your choice.=
  We will not be angry with what you chose.  Freedom is the right of all Se=
ntient beings.  And I sense this is what you and Perceptor long for.  I am =
giving you what you are entitled to. Now, I sense a hot breeze but then, th=
ere's also a down draft that seems a bit temperate.  I'm getting a fix on t=
hat down draft and I'm going to see if I can map it out internally and try =
to get a map grid over to Rodimus and Night Shift.  If you want, Perceptor,=
 I can give you this grid also, but you have to allow me to do it."

He kne=
els down beside Dark Hawk.

" It's all right, since you're injured, I'll ca=
rry you with me, if you'll let me."
